Dear Andrea Melendrez:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the violations
identified in the report, a corrective action plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15
days from the date of this letter, must be completed and routed in CWLM, and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result in
compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact me. In
any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an acceptable
corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any questions. In
the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone immediately, please contact
the area manager Samantha Way at 517-243-9743.
Sincerely,
Shannon (Shay) Mavis
Licensing Consultant

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 Intervention standards and prohibitions
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 3/5/25, a staff member pushed a youth into the wall and
pinned the youth against the wall. The youth kicked the staff
member, and the staff member scratched the youth's leg with their
fingers, resulting in a long bright red scratch on the youth's leg.
Investigation INTERVIEWS:
Complainant was interviewed via phone on 3/12/25.
Complainant reported she didn’t have any additional information
besides what was listed in the allegations.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on 3/10/25
in coordination with MDHHS Worker. Youth A reported he was
being rude to Youth B because he doesn’t like her. Youth A
reported he was walking towards the vestibule. Youth A reported
Staff 4 yelled “he’s trying to go after [Youth B]”, but Youth A
reported he wasn’t. Youth A reported Staff 1 blocked the door
leading to the vestibule, but Youth A pushed himself through the
door anyways. Youth A reported Staff 1 pushed him against the
wall and held him there for less than a minute. Youth A reported
he said, “what the hell man?” to Staff 1. Youth A reported he could
tell Staff 1 was angry because of the look on his face, but Staff 1
didn’t say anything to him. Youth A reported he kicked Staff 1
once. Youth A reported when he attempted to kick Staff 1 a
second time, Staff 1 tried to block the kick and ended up
scratching Youth A’s leg by accident. Youth A reported he knows
the scratch was not intentional. Youth A reported what angered
him the most about the interaction was Staff 1 pushing him. Youth
A reported he knew Staff 1 did it to keep him away from Youth B,
but he still didn’t like being pushed. Youth A reported he felt Staff
1 reacted to Staff 4’s warning, but didn’t have the full story of what
was happening. Youth A reported he and Staff 1 talked that night
and processed the situation. Youth A reported he didn’t feel Staff
1 came after him personally and just felt there could have been
better communication during the situation. Youth A reported Staff
4 is skittish and yells often, so he felt that set everything in motion
to be more escalated than it needed to be. Youth A reported he
2

doesn’t feel unsafe at the facility, and didn’t require any medical
attention for the scratch on his leg. Youth A reported staff have
done a great job keeping him and Youth B away from each other,
but the facility is only so big, therefore it can be difficult.
Youth B was interviewed via phone on 4/3/25 in coordination
with MDHHS Worker. Youth B reported Youth A was coming
after her most of the day and she was trying to get away from him.
Youth B reported she went into the vestibule and began putting
her shoes on so she could go outside. Youth B reported Youth C
came into the vestibule. Soon after, Youth A came in the vestibule
and Staff 1 stopped him from getting to Youth B. Youth B reported
Staff 1 pushed Youth A away from him, but Youth A kept coming
back. Youth B reported Youth A became angrier when Staff 1
pushed him, and he began trying to fight Staff 1. Youth B reported
Staff 2 separated Staff 1 and Youth A and then Youth A left the
area with Staff 2. Youth B reported the situation wasn’t Staff 1’s
fault and Staff 1 didn’t do anything wrong. Youth B reported Staff 1
was just trying to keep her safe, and he did that. Youth B reported
Youth A apologized to Staff 1 after the incident.
Youth C was interviewed face to face at the facility on 3/10/25
in coordination with MDHHS Worker. Youth C reported she was
in the vestibule area with Youth B and Staff 1. Youth C reported
Youth A was mad at Youth B and tried barging into the vestibule.
Youth B reported Staff 1 attempted to hold the door closed, but
Youth A got in anyways. Youth C reported she was hiding behind
the door when Youth A came in because she didn’t want to get
hurt. Youth C reported Youth A was kicking Staff 1 and Youth C
believes Staff 1 got injured. Youth C reported Youth A was going
after Youth B and Staff 1 stopped him. Youth C reported Staff 1
didn’t push Youth A, but Staff 1 held Youth A back so Youth A
couldn’t get to Youth B. Youth C reported Staff 1 held Youth A
back with two arms and his hip. Youth C reported she doesn’t
know if Youth A got injured. Youth C reported Youth A went onto
the main floor afterwards and everything calmed down.
Chief Administrator (CA) was interviewed face to face at the
facility on 3/10/25 in coordination with MDHHS Worker. CA
reported she was not present for the incident, but she gathered
information from watching the video. CA reported there have been
no previous incidents or concerns involving Staff 1. CA reported
Staff 1 could have handled the situation better. CA reported Staff
1 appeared to be caught off guard, so he reacted, and his
reactions came off more aggressive than he intended. CA
reported she watched the video footage with Staff 1 and talked to
3

him about techniques that could have been more helpful during
the situation. CA reported Youth A did not complain about Staff 1
afterwards, and they haven’t had any bad interactions since the
incident.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 3/10/25
in coordination with MDHHS Worker. Staff 1 reported there was
an incident between Youth A and Youth B, but he wasn’t sure
what started it. Staff 1 reported Staff 2 was attempting to de-
escalate Youth A, and Youth B went into the sensory room. While
Youth B was in the sensory room, Youth A was banging on the
door aggressively. After a while, Youth B exited the sensory room
and asked to go for a walk. Staff 1 reported when he went into the
vestibule, Staff 2 was trying to distract Youth A with something
else. Staff 1 reported he was told to keep Youth A and Youth B
separated. Staff 1 reported he was in the doorway of the vestibule
while Youth B and Youth C were in the vestibule. Youth C was
behind the door Staff 1 was standing at and Youth B was sitting
on the floor putting her shoes on. Staff 1 reported he saw Youth A
coming towards the vestibule and heard someone yell, “keep
[Youth A] out of there”. Staff 1 reported he stepped into the
vestibule and tried to shut the door to hold it shut so Youth A
couldn’t enter. However, Youth A was stronger than Staff 1,
pushed the door open and entered the vestibule. Staff 1 reported
he used one hand to block Youth A, blocked him twice and said,
“hold on”, but Youth A just started kicking him. Staff 1 reported he
put his hand up and Youth A walked forward into his hand. Staff 1
reported he was trying to back Youth A up, but didn’t feel like he
pushed him. Staff 1 reported Youth A threw a football at him. Staff
1 reported Staff 2 and Staff 3 came into the vestibule and
separated him, and Youth A. Staff 1 reported during the incident,
Youth A attempted to kick him a few times, and Staff 1’s nail got
bent backwards when trying to block him. Staff 1 reported he saw
afterwards Youth A had a scratch on his leg but isn’t sure when it
happened during the incident. Staff 1 reported he assumed it
happened when Youth A tried to kick him, and he blocked it. Staff
1 reported he went through some coaching during the video
review but was told he wasn’t going to be written up. Staff 1
reported he was told he could have positioned himself better by
standing more in front of Youth B than he was. Staff 1 reported he
spoke with Youth A later that night to process the situation, and
there was no animosity afterwards.
Staff 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 3/10/25
in coordination with MDHHS Worker. Staff 2 reported Youth A
was sitting at the table right inside the facility. Staff 2 reported she
4

is the staff with the closest relationship to him, and she could tell
he was irritated. Staff 2 reported she tried to make bracelets with
him and play cards with him to distract him. Staff 2 reported when
Youth A gets angry, he picks a target, and this time it was Youth
B. Youth A kept repeating statements to Youth B such as “no one
loves you” and “you don’t have a family”. Staff 2 reported Youth B
tried to leave the situation by going to the sensory room. Staff 2
reported Youth A went to the sensory room door and began
banging on it. Staff 2 reported she redirected Youth A’s behavior
by stepping in between him and the door. Youth B came out of the
sensory room and stated she wanted to take a walk. Youth B went
to the vestibule area. On her way there, Youth A tried to throw a
football at Youth B, but Staff 2 prevented it from happening. Staff
2 reported Youth A began heading for the vestibule area, and
Staff 2 let him proceed because she thought Youth B was already
outside. Staff 2 reported she heard Staff 4 yell, “[Staff 1] close the
door”. Staff 1 tried to close the door to the vestibule, but Youth A
forced his way through and then the door to the vestibule shut.
Staff 2 reported a second later, the door opened, and she saw
Youth A getting put against the wall by Staff 1. Staff 2 reported
she stepped in between Youth A and Staff 1 to separate them.
Staff 2 reported she hoped it would de-escalate the situation by
being in between them. Staff 2 reported unfortunately it didn’t help
because she is short, and they reached over her shoulders. Staff
2 reported Youth A was trying to hit Staff 1 over her shoulders, but
she couldn’t see what Staff 1 was doing because her back was
towards him. Staff 2 reported she redirected Youth A away from
the situation. Staff 2 reported she saw blood dripping down Youth
A's leg, so she gave him a few minutes to be in his room to de-
escalate, and then she went into his room to tend to his wound
with alcohol wipes and band-aids. Staff 2 reported Youth A was
finally ready to talk and began crying immediately, Staff 2 reported
Youth A said, “I’m going to beat the fuck out of [Staff 1]. Why did
he just do that?”. Staff 2 reported she tried to be objective and
supportive while she processed the situation with him, and he de-
escalated. Staff 2 reported she encouraged Youth A to talk to Staff
1 later and express himself in a healthy way. Staff 2 reported Staff
1 and Youth A talked for approximately 10 minutes. Youth A
apologized to Staff 1 for coming through the vestibule door, and
admitted he was planning to follow Youth B and “keep talking
shit”. Staff 1 said, “I’m sorry it got there. I just didn’t know what you
were going to do”. Staff 2 reported Youth A and Staff 1 have
interacted fine with each other ever since the incident, and they
have a good connection. Staff 2 reported the movements Staff 1
made towards Youth A were not the best in the situation. Staff 2
reported Youth A reacts poorly to men in some escalated
5

situations based on his trauma, so Staff 1’s actions likely triggered
Youth A further.
Staff 3 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 3/10/25
in coordination with MDHHS Worker. Staff 3 reported Youth A
was giving Youth B a hard time on and off all day. Staff 3 reported
he heard a commotion, and went to see what was going on so he
could help if needed. Staff 3 reported he saw Youth A and Staff 1
in a scuffle, and he immediately began trying to de-escalate Youth
A. Staff 3 reported it was clear Staff 1 was trying to protect Youth
B and Youth C, but Staff 1 pushing Youth A was questionable.
Staff 3 reported he talked to Staff 1 about the situation afterwards
and offered suggestions of how Staff 1 could have handled it
better. Staff 3 reported Staff 1 reacted quickly to keep Youth A
away, which was more of a quick reaction rather than processing
the whole situation. Staff 3 reported when staff block youth, they
are supposed to put a hand in front of themselves and step
backwards into the movement if a youth goes forward, but they
are not supposed to use a forward motion with youth.
VIDEO REVIEWED:
Video footage from 3/5/25 was reviewed, but there is no audio on
the video. Youth B is seen in the vestibule putting her shoes on.
Staff 1 stands in the doorway with the door open. Youth C opens
the door and comes into the vestibule with Youth B. Staff 1 is
holding the door open while he continues to stand in the doorway.
Youth C and Staff 1 look quickly towards the open door. Youth C
runs and stands behind the door against the wall while Staff 1
attempts to shut the door and hold it closed. Youth A pushes the
door open while Staff 1 is still trying to push it closed. Youth A
manages to push his way inside the vestibule and Staff 1 shuts
the door. Staff 1 immediately releases the door and pushes Youth
A into the corner with his hand outstretched holding Youth A there.
Youth A kicks Staff 1 and Staff 1 steps backwards. Staff 2 opens
the vestibule door. Staff 1 steps forward and shoves Youth A with
two hands against the wall again. Staff 2 immediately steps in
between them to separate them. Youth A continues to hit and kick
Staff 1. Youth A then throws a football at Staff 1, but Staff 1
dodges it. Staff 3 stands at the door observing while Staff 2 is in
between Youth A and Staff 1 separating them. Youth A bends
over, picks up the football, and throws it at Staff 1 once more.
Staff 1 picks it up, stands behind Staff 2 and holds it over her
head. Youth A tries to hit the football out of Staff 1’s hands and
Staff 1 attempts to block Youth A’s hits. Then Youth A turns
around and walks back into the facility with Staff 2.
6

DOCUMENTS REVIEWED:
• Incident report dated 3/5/25 authored by Staff 3 states
Youth A came out of the shower and exchanged words with
a peer. The quick interaction trigged Youth A and he
escalated to yelling and instigating his peer. The peer
stayed quiet and attempted to get away from Youth A,
however, Youth A followed the peer wherever she went.
Staff 1 stood between Youth A and the peer to deflect
Youth A’s attempts to strike the peer. Realizing it wasn’t
going as planned, Youth A began kicking Staff 1. Staff 1
used personal safety techniques by blocking and backing
up. During the incident, Youth A sustained a scratch on his
leg. Youth A then went back to his room and began to calm
down on his own.
• Safety plan for Youth A and Youth B dated 12/12/24 states
limit Youth A and Youth B’s interactions to only what is
necessary. If they are in the same room, staff must be
present.
• Disciplinary Policy states any cruel and unusual
punishments/practices, such as physical punishments such
as pushing or roughly handling a child, are prohibited
including
• Staff 1 has one disciplinary record in his employee file
unrelated to this incident. Staff 1 was trained in CPI (1/9/24,
1/29/24 & 12/18/24) and disciplinary policies on 12/17/24.
Analysis The facility is found in non-compliance as per interviews
conducted, documentation reviewed, and video footage reviewed,
Staff 1 pushed Youth A twice during the incident, and pushing a
youth is prohibited according to the facility’s policy and this rule.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established
SIR #2023C0000628 dated 8/23/23; CAP approved 9/12/23
SIR #2023C0000544 dated 7/20/23; CAP approved 8/15/23
SIR #2023C0000500 dated 9/7/23; CAP approved 8/14/23

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
